TopicTitle: Spaceplane abort system and posting pictures

Articles.Content:
I am designing a passenger space plane but i'm having some trouble with my last resort abort system.

If the vehicle is in-atmosphere but has no way of landing safely , my abort system is quite simply just for the kerbals to jump out and use their parachutes to land. The only problem is that when they jump out , they hit the vertical stabiliser. I have tried using a hinge to rotate it out of way but the kraken didn't seem to like that. I've also tried using side decouplers to detach it but i cant seem to get abort action groups working. Does anyone have any ideas?

 

Also how do you post pictures from your computer on the forums?
Embarrassingly , i just found that using a different hinge fixed the kraken problem so nevermind the first question. The second question i havent worked out still.
Maybe add a part with a door facing another direction?

You could do it the Kerbal way, and put all your passengers on external seats inside a cargo bay. Mission going south? Just arm their chutes, turn their ejection force up and fire then out of their seats to parachute safely down- just remember to open the bay doors first! You might even be able to set up an action group to eject them all at once.

Edited September 12, 2020 by jimmymcgoochie

I now have another question. My spaceplane has a little elevator to bring kerbals to the ground from the plane. The problem is that the elevator is in the cargo bay and the only way to use it is to start in the external seat on it , is there any way to transfer kerbals to the external seat without performing an EVA from the crew cabins?

10 minutes ago, Soyuzturtle said:

is there any way to transfer kerbals to the external seat without performing an EVA from the crew cabins?

No, the only way to get into an external seat is by going on EVA. You could change your elevator to use a Mk1 Lander Can instead if you want to transfer crew into it.

3 hours ago, Soyuzturtle said:

Also how do you post pictures from your computer on the forums?

Post the pictures somewhere where you can get a link to the image, such as Imgur or Discord. Copy the image link, and when you paste the link the image will appear.

the mk 2 spaceplane cockpit is a great lifting body, meaning it can "glide" on its own without any large wings. I use a hidden decoupler behind a mk2 cockpit with canards on the cockpit to act like a escape shuttle that can reenter and land on its own. parachutes help with landing.
